passages.name: annesad
passages.text:
"Yeah she was fun to share a lunch a with before but now, pardon my french, she's a bitch."

[[Oh that seem pretty harsh.|harsh]]
[[Something like that.|agree]]

passages.name: INLINE CSS
d8
passages.text:
Well maybe that's not fair.
Everybody has routines and often when they complain about
other people doing the same stuff all the time.
Those people are just mad that they're not doing the stuff THEY usually do.

Routine was an enemy in your role as a serial killer.

Maybe the situation can be summed up by
simply realizing that no night is TV dinner night.

[[...|d9]]

passages.name: d9
passages.text:
You have killed since you met Alex.

It felt nice and horrific that the old urge still remain
dormant inside you, biding its time for the right "guest" to walk by.

It came again.
The first time you were afraid that the attraction shouldn't
contain the urge and instead result in you being attracted to another person and, maybe, end up having an affair like in some kind of stereotypical novel.

But it was still there.
To kill again after a short hiatus was wonderful.
It was as if you've never killed before...

Once or twice in your life you’ve met that ”guest”.
That special ”guest” that truly fuels your urge beyond any other.

Maybe that’s what you need now in all this routine? [[A good solid (violent) kill.|k1]]

passages.name: d6
passages.text:
[img[https://corruptreality.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/t1.png]]

<<timedinsert 2s>>[[click for happiness|d62]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: d7
passages.text:
At the same time.
Some routine has been established:

@@font-weight:bold;Monday@@ is experimental wok night.
@@font-weight:bold;Tuesday@@ is creamy pasta night.
@@font-weight:bold;Wednesday@@ is across the border night (Canada NOT Mexico).
@@font-weight:bold;Thursday@@ is leftovers.
@@font-weight:bold;Friday@@ is surprise night (you take turns).
@@font-weight:bold;Saturday@@ is shellfish fiesta.
@@font-weight:bold;Sunday@@ is slurping soup sunday.


<<timedinsert 10s>>Love is one thing...
But the previous lack of routine has made you realize how much you [[loathe it|d8]]...<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: d4
passages.text:
You've never been tortured before.
Until now.
To endure an ear being cut off.
To sustain the pain you feel as fire boils your eye ball until it pops.
To suffer as someone pulls the nails from your fingers with some pliers.

That is one thing.

But to wait by the phone.

That's something completely different...


[[but then a ring is heard...|act4]]

links.text: but then a ring is heard...

passages.name: d5
passages.text:
One date became another, and then another and then ten more.

Ten dates became a relationship.

That relationship is now manifesting itself via moving boxes in this...new apartment.

It went fast. Just a few months.
Alex wanted to get some kind of approval from some relative called Drew and maybe a friend or two. You became angry for suggesting something like that (but of course you didn't say anything).

You have no family to grade your partner.
Why should someone else judge you as an old time slave owner?

[[what is happiness by the way?|d6]]

links.text: what is happiness by the way?

passages.name: d2
passages.text:
One might think that this is your first date.
As you're kind of a serial killer recluse.
But one would be wrong.

In your younger days you sought normality and gave it a shot.
It resulted in two dates and a feeble version of the very first intercourse.

And also a loss in hope of ever finding that place where normality rules
and you don't thrive on pouring acid people’s faces.

Since then you've been a loner.
Someone that's on the inside looking in.
Like a monkey at a zoo.
(but are you the monkey looking out, or a person looking in?)

[[wine! entrees! bread!|d3]]

passages.name: d3
passages.text:
You both nibble on a piece of somewhat stale bread
during the solo reading of the menu.

They don't have that many courses so this is just
you two using the menus as shields before the date commences.

But as long as both do it. What's the harm?

During other dates you've had this fantasy.
A fantasy not based on torture and pain.
But rather on truth.
You talk and chat and speak and discuss.
But you have to lie...to some extent.

In your head you re-play the dialogue and adapt
it to an accepting and truthful reality where you can be you...

[[menus down|date]]

passages.name: d1
passages.text:
As you've longed for friday to come.
And now you're scared.
You!?
A serial killer that without any problem tortures people and take their lives...

But emotions...
That's something to long for but hopefully never have to deal with.

Alex looks even better than when you first met.

The restaurant is half-full which is nice.
(you never understood the charm of crowds, like hanging around in bars).

[[you sit down|d2]]

passages.name: j15
passages.text:
As you tried to turn around "It" gently placed its paw (or claw or hand) on your back and pressed you firmly, but not hurtful, to the ground.

You shat your pants.

At first you thought it was a bear or some other large animal. But no.

"It" let you go and walked away, but stopped at the fringe of the forest, looking at you from behind some shrubbery as if to say "here but no further". You understood and dared (after a few weeks) to again venture into the woods.

This time you saw "It" behind the same shrubbery, but "It" let you be.

"It" smelled horrible.

The car suddenly feels different as you go from gravel to asphalt which means that you’re closer to home.

[[...|j16]]

passages.name: job10
passages.text:
So against all kinds of better judgement, you start to follow
this person inside the Walmart.

But you don't feel worried.
For once you have no intentions of killing this person.

This is a feeling you've longed for.
But now as you feel it.
It's frighting and more or less true horror.

<<timedinsert 8s>>Cause think if the person doesn’t like you back?!?!?<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 12s>>[[At the check out counter the person drops something|job11]]<<endtimedinsert>>

links.text: At the check out counter the person drops something

passages.name: e9
passages.text:
A text message commanding you to return Alex's calls.

[[Should you leave for the container by yourself?|eself1]]

[[Or should you invite Alex with you?|ealex1]]

At this state you're not sure if you are up to this.
But you do know that tonight.
Somebody has to die...

links.text: Should you leave for the container by yourself?
Or should you invite Alex with you?

passages.name: choose
passages.text: CHOOSE\n\n<<timedgoto "w1" 0.5s>>

passages.name: job14
passages.text:
That was probably the longest conversation you've
had with another human being for a very long time.

The majority of the talks you engage in are pretty
one-sided as the other person is gagged.

But you must admit that you are both socially capable and
quite chatty during those short conversations.

This was also the best conversation for a very long time...


The feelings and urges that brew inside you seem to have //paused//.
(you dare not think of them as lost, and frankly you're not sure that you'd want to).

Instead you miss Alex.

[[But it's only been like 2 minutes since your last talk. Can't it be friday NOW!|act3]]

links.text: But it's only been like 2 minutes since your last talk. Can't it be friday NOW!

passages.text: the urge

passages.name: east
passages.text:
The east wall's only value is the door.
The container’s only exit.
It’s heavy, but you’ve learned the technique.

[[ok|me]]

<<set $east = true>>

passages.name: pd8
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Friday the 1st@@
Everybody gets a job in here.
As do I and I'm now a sanitation specialist with focus on fecal matter. That, oh you wonderful diary, is my way of saying that I clean the fucking toilets.
Normally I’d go through enough bodily fluids to last me a lifetime each day but then, the very next day I get a refill!

I'm used to cleaning (I used to <<cyclinglink "kill" "cry">> on the outside you see) blood and other fun stuff. But this is just...just shit!
>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd9]]@@

passages.name: end2
passages.text: <<timedgoto "epi" 3s>>

passages.name: wfax
passages.text:
@@font-family:courier new;font-size:70%;//torture method #43//:@@


@@font-family:Arial;font-size:250%;font-weight:bold;"The Fax"@@

@@font-family:courier;font-size:85%;

This is a classic from the 80s that's great to use on younger people without any form of none-digital communication experience.

1) Provide the "guest" with a fax and a manual written in every language but English.
2) Force the guest to learn how to operate the fax.
3) Make the guest fax someone something somewhere.@@



[[done|w2]]

<<set $weapon += 1>>
<<set $fax = true>>

passages.name: pd28
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Monday the 29th@@

F U C K pottery!!

And fuck everybody in pottery class and fuck all the clay in the world!

How the fucking hell should anyone manage to keep that vase standing up?!

I don't know what the hell got in me?! Never again!

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd29]]@@

passages.name: torture
passages.text:
You hang up the phone.
These little prank calls are fun.
You think of how you did it as a child.

You look at the table in front of you
The person laying there - your ”guest” - is sedated, slowly twitching as the muscles
really can't shake the reflexes.

Primal reflexes that are too weak to swift the "guest" away on a white steed.
Instead your guest is blissfully frolicking away in dreamland.

You [[look|look]] at your guest.

passages.name: pd29
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Sunday the 9th@@

I've come to the conclusion that <<cyclinglink "prison" "life">> is hell.
Nobody will change that.
No class will make it feel better.
Prison is just what it is.

Diary...

I got plenty years left. But I'm abandoning you.
I'll spare you from my thoughts and ideas and my agony and misery and my hope and tears.

[[thanks for this...|act5p]]

passages.name: wgranny
passages.text:
@@font-family:courier new;font-size:70%;//torture method #99//:@@


@@font-family:Arial;font-size:250%;font-weight:bold;"The Granny Smith"@@

@@font-family:courier;font-size:85%;

Old people seem to think they've done the ultimate trip a long time ago to a mediocre location. And theses vacation photographs are still so very much fun to look at apparently.

1) To add extra torture to ”The Granny Smith” the granny has gotten her hands one of those old projects with slides.
2) The "guest" has to sit through a horrible and long guide through granny's trip to Ohio in 1982.
3) Not one slide is turned the right way.@@


[[done|w2]]
<<set $weapon += 1>>
<<set $granny = true>>

passages.name: game
passages.text:
One wall is always particularly intriguing!
A psychos funhouse. Your funhouse!
No limitations.
Only imagination.

[[Walk up|w1]] to the west wall..

<<set $weapon = 1>>

passages.name: pd24
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Friday the 20th@@

I couldn't really restrain myself as I've felt <<cyclinglink "love" "the urge">> grow inside me when I spend time with Sam.

In many ways I'm glad for these feelings. I'm glad for the confusion it creates in my mind and I haven't really sighed once as I do my daily crap removal.

But what now? Where will this head?

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd25]]@@

passages.name: pd25
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Sunday the 10th@@

Oh fucking hell. Now I've done it!
I <<cyclinglink "KISSED" "KILLED">> SAM IN THE SHOWER!!

I told you diary. I couldn't restrain myself and it got really weird in the shower as some people were still in there. It was like people didn’t want to be there, but at the same they didn’t be noticed so they stayed.

Now I'm afraid I'm alone again...

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd26]]@@

passages.name: h4-2
passages.text:
You've never eaten human flesh...
<<timedinsert 4s>>

Ok it was this one time!

When you were new to this.
A newly graduate serial killer.
It feels like most serial killers go through that phase where you experiment a bit.

Maybe instead of a homosexual experience you ate some meat of a plumber...

But you spat it out. Most of it.<<endtimedinsert>>


<<timedinsert 6s>>
[[gross!|h5]]
<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: lenospin2
passages.text: [img[https://corruptreality.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/leno2.gif]]\n\n<<timedgoto "h4-2" 6s>>

passages.name: job7
passages.text:
You've made your mistakes though.
People borrow cars and you still have nightmares
about that time you snuck into a house but realized
that someone just borrowed mom's car.

That old lady really could scream.

So nowadays you're careful...

[[You take out a pack of smokes|job8]]

links.text: You take out a pack of smokes

passages.name: job6
passages.text:
You start to observe the person you just saw.
At this moment the attraction transforms into //the urge//.

Something without control or means to control it.

You keep doing what you're paid to do, stocking tampons.
But with one eye at your new soon-to-be ”guest”.

It's crucial to get some information about the person.
You can't just follow people around like a lunatic (that would be craaaazyyyy).

You took up smoking just so you could take cigarette breaks
and try to catch a glimpse of someone's license plate...

It's not that easy to get information about address via license plate numbers, but there are ways. Best is to spot someone you actually CAN follow. Like in a crowd or in traffic...

[[(one of the most interesting ”guests” you've had was someone you spotted in a traffic jam in another car and just followed it)|job7]]

links.text: (one of the most interesting ”guests” you've had was someone you spotted in a traffic jam in another car and just followed it)

passages.name: job5
passages.text:
You see someone.
A feeling is born. An attraction.
But it's dark and unwanted.
But at the same time a part of life.

How would you live your life without it?

It's the only certain thing you have, and have been for quite some time now...

Up to this date you've never just felt pure attraction without all the other "issues".

[[Maybe one day|job6]]

passages.name: job4
passages.text:
It starts as for most...

<<timedinsert 1s>>
Very beautiful.<<timedinsert 7.7s>>@@font-size:120%;color:darkred; MAIM!@@<<endtimedinsert>> Cute nose.<<timedinsert 5s>>@@font-size:120%;color:darkred; I WANNA CUT IT OFF!@@<<endtimedinsert>> Nice body.<<timedinsert 6s>>@@font-size:120%;color:darkred; BURN THE FACE!@@<<endtimedinsert>> Dresses nice.<<timedinsert 9.5s>>@@font-size:200%;color:darkred; HELP@@<<endtimedinsert>> Seems smart.<<timedinsert 7s>>@@font-size:120%;color:darkred; DISMEMBER!@@<<endtimedinsert>> Single or not? <<timedinsert 7.9s>>@@font-size:120%;color:darkred;SEVER!@@<<endtimedinsert>> Glasses are kinda hot. <<timedinsert 7.5s>>@@font-size:120%;color:darkred;GOUGE THE EYES!@@<<endtimedinsert>> Kids or not? <<timedinsert 8.1s>>@@font-size:120%;color:darkred;MUTILATE!@@<<endtimedinsert>> What's in the shopping cart?
Should I say "Hi"?<<timedinsert 8.3s>>@@font-size:120%;color:darkred; SHOULD I KILL?@@<<endtimedinsert>><<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 12s>>[[But you can't help it...|job5]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: j8
passages.text:
"Seclusion is delusion".
You're proud of that little phrase.
And it's true.

Your container could be found by someone, but purely by accident.
No one would find it otherwise as it used to belong to the some hunters or the army or maybe just a weird cult and they were real careful about its location.

You've added to the secrecy already shrouded amongst these trees.

You stumbled across it by accident as you dumped the head of a teacher many years ago and felt a cooling ease setting in as you you realized that you finally could leave your cellar.

Instead you've turned your cellar into a perfect fusion of home spa and entertainment area.

[[(maybe some jacuzzi time later?)|j8-1]]

passages.name: j9
passages.text:
You always (even if it not needed) take a deep breath as you see your Volvo shimmer in the moonlight. "It" lets you pass this time too. Your ”guest” never makes it out alive, but ”It” is maybe a better host?

You sit down in the car and are about to turn the ignition. But stop!

You always do this.
The whole hike to the car, you're calm.
But well in the car you get all jumpy. But not about ”It”.

You get out, walk around the car and scout the surrounding area.

But blue lights or sirens never light up the pines and redwoods.
No agents in dark shades (why shades during the night?) rush out from the trees with their guns raised.

[[...|j10]]

passages.name: job1
passages.text:
You work.
On the floor.
At a Walmart.
You unpack new stuff rolling in daily.

You try to avoid talking to people, or at least customers.

It would look suspicious if you didn't talk to your co-workers.
So you say ”hi” and ask about what people did this weekend.
You answer them back. Now and then you eat lunch together.
But friends is a luxury you can’t afford...unfortunately.

Maybe it’s not a dream job, but you need to blend in.
And to disappear into the crowd.

Walmart provides this...[[anonymity|job2]]

passages.name: j4
passages.text:
The clothes you used are burned.
The cleaning supplies are burned.
The plastic is also burned.
The only thing cleaned and kept are your tools.

Extracting the used tools from the dead body before chopping it into smaller pieces is a must.

[[The last object to wash is you|j5]]

links.text: The last object to wash is you

passages.name: j5
passages.text:
Outside you've installed a small hose.
It acts as makeshift shower and contains just a few gallons of water.
Enough to make you clean.

The moss on the ground acts as nature's sponge, cleaning up your sweat, blood and DNA.

You always make sure to set a little fire after you've showered.
Just to be sure...or as sure as you can be.

<<timedinsert 10s>>But then you stop. Suddenly. "It" is near. "It" never hurts you but it roams these woods.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 13s>>You have a kind of agreement with "It". And even though "It" doesn't really speak your or any type of language you feel that you're on terms where the boundaries are drawn.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 17s>>[[Time to head home|j6]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: j6
passages.text:
Backpacks comes in all shapes and sizes and you've invested in a real big one.

A human body, chopped into pieces, can actually fit in there.
It's extremely heavy and the hike to the dump site is long.

But if you'd ran into someone it won't look suspicious.
You're in the woods. Maybe you've just been out camping?
Picking some mushrooms or berries.
Maybe hunting?

Getting the body out to the container is, surprisingly, much easier.
Just act a bit drunk, carry the body as if your guest has passed out.
Nobody would start questioning you in the middle of the night in the middle of the woods. 

And if they did...you or ”It” would...resolve any differences that may arise.

[[But so far, you've never met anyone willing to enter these woods...|j7]]

links.text: But so far, you've never met anyone willing to enter these woods...

passages.name: j7
passages.text:
You do understand what will happen to you if they caught you.

"They".

It's an interesting concept, often used in movies and books.
But "they" do exist.

You've come to understand that all people have their own "they".
It can be the police, parents, bullies, co-workers or partner.

You've gone through a lot of "they" in your life.
But now you must say that you have a group of ”they” consisting of police, FBI, CIA and other fun acronyms that understands nothing as they maybe (MAYBE!) find a leg or hand now and then.

But your existence is a mystery to them.

[[Almost at the dump site...|j8]]

passages.name: anneglad
passages.text:
"So If she's so rich now, how come she still steals other people's donuts from the office fridge?"

[[She does?!|stealing]]
[[Isn't it a mistake?|mistake]]

passages.name: j1
passages.text:
So it's over now.
Your guest is no more and one of the most boring moments
in your life will once again take place.
The clean-up.
Your container out in the woods is more or less safe from curious eyes.
But you can't really leave it in this condition.

Someone might find it.
But mostly as you still remember the pungent, stale
smell as you were lazy and left blood and intestines
to marinate the whole thing as the sun raised the temperature.

[[never again...|j2]]

passages.name: j2
passages.text:
You don't keep your own home this neat.
Scrubbing away filth, blood, bile, guts, nails, hair and tears.

The soundproof container holds your poor, badly sung version of
"You can call me Al" within its bowels.

<<timedinsert 8s>>//(one might crack a joke about hearing you sing is the real torture. but of course that's not true)//<<endtimedinsert>>

The energy you put into is a must.
Also, maybe unwillingly, a part of the ritual.
You're not that keen on cleaning it for yourself or a hypothetical police officer or someone just picking berries in the woods, but rather for the next guest that’ll visit.

The next guest must feel welcome and you even, sometime, sit on the table to warm it up a bit as it can get horribly cold during the winter.

[[...|j3]]

@@font-family:courier;font-size:85%;

This is a classic but with a innovative add-on if one feels like it. (And also a possible twist if you have sharp enough pliers and duct tape left from "The Popper").

1) Use to pliers to pull out the finger and toe nails.
2) Shove the finger nails back into the toes and vice versa.
3) If possible you can also cut off fingers/toes and switch places using the duct tape to fixate them.@@

passages.name: lars
passages.text:
"No I haven't talked to Lars. You know he doesn't like someone stirring up the workplace.

And I understand that gentle man. Our jobs matter, and we matter, as Lars says:

//In this job: what matters is the matter at hand.//

So I just want everyone to do a good job."

passages.name: ealex3
passages.text:
Alex stands there.
At the parking lot.

Alex looks both mad and scared at the same time.
Some animals can, in some way, feel that an earthquake
or lightning storm is on its way.

Maybe Alex is like that animal right now.

Alex gets in and you [[drive off...|ealex4]].

During the drive your head races as you suddenly see a way out of this where "It" (whatever "It" may be) can be of assistance, and you might not have to slay Alex by your own hand.

passages.name: ealex5
passages.text:
The rest of the ride Alex is just quite.
Maybe scared of what might come.
Maybe scared to ask the right questions.

As you park (and you had to shut of the book on tape just where it was getting interesting) Alex still doesn't talk.

You wave your hand. Signaling Alex to follow.

Alex never liked the outdoors.
And the sighs of getting a branch in the face, at this moment, are surprisingly honest.
Even as Alex might be scared beyond anything before, nature is still horrible. And yes nature contains something truly horrible.

And then, like a child:

<<timedinsert 14s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"Are we there yet?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 16s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"Yes actually. We are."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 19s>>[[the container is just in front of you|ealex6]]<<endtimedinsert>>

links.text: the container is just in front of you

passages.text:
<<timedinsert 2s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"So where are we going?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 4s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"I'll try to answer your questions but we have to get there first."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 7s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"Get where? Can't you just tell me or talk to me? I'm kinda worried you know. I don't want to think the worst. Did you and Drew have an affair? Is that it? Or is it something...else? Where’s Drew!!"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 13s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"No nothing like that. Let's listen to //American Psycho// on tape."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 16s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"ok?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 18s>>[[...|ealex5]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: pd9
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Thursday the 21st@@
As I passed some fellow inmates I almost asked if they had any plans for the weekend. I used to do that at my old job. Almost like a reflex. Old habits die hard I guess.
I haven't killed anyone for almost 6 months. But the urge is dormant. Everybody in here is a potential <<cyclinglink "victim" "lover">> but I guess my brain has to adjust to being incarcerated.

Picked up a rock today during cleaning and found out it was just a piece of poo. Yay, surprises are fun!
>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd10]]@@

passages.name: ealex6
passages.text:
If you're not used to the smell of blood you can't really place it.

Alex shivers as the smell fills both of your noses.

<<timedinsert 5s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"Would you mind staying outside? I’m gonna show you something"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 7s>>(Alex takes a step outside the container as you stay just where you are)<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 9s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"Where are we?! What are you?! Where's Drew!?! What is it you wanna show me?!"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 12s>>(you close the door, locking you in and Alex out)<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 15s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;(you scream)"Where we are isn't that important. I haven’t managed to figure out what ”It” is really. I know who I am. I'm a serial killer..."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 18s>>(Alex reacts to this by screaming from outside the container)<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 20s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"What?! Let me IN! What the fuck are you talking about?!?!"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 24s>>(then suddenly Alex gets quiet, as if spooked by something, and then a scream and then...[[nothing more|end2]])<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: pd7
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Monday the 24th@@
Tick tock, tick tock goes the fucking clock!
Yay! It's been a <<cyclinglink "month" "lifetime">> in this hell hole.

"Hole" is actually a good description.
A black hole that consumes all that enters.

But, dear diary, I've decided not to be consumed.
28 years isn't that long. If I manage to keep the urge at bay
I might get out even sooner.


>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd8]]@@

passages.name: pd6
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Tuesday the 11th@@

Everything is horrible in here!
The food, the furniture, the other inmates and I have to take a dump in public!!

<<cyclinglink "Prison" "Life">> isn't at all as in the movies. It's worse.


And time is so fucking slow it drives me insane!

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd7]]@@

passages.name: pd5
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Friday the 14th@@
So I'm in <<cyclinglink "prison" "hell">> now. It's fun to see how stuff pan out I guess. Nothing odd about them pinning the decapitated head on me really. Very few times it turns out that old ladies kill people between the sewing circles. The scrawny teenager and driving instructor had alibis and I didn't. Crap.

So, dear diary. To keep me somewhat sane I’ve decided to write in you now and then.
After all I got (FUCKING!) 28 years!!!!!

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd6]]@@

passages.name: f23
passages.text:
Why did "It" let you play around in these woods?
It's apparent that others dare not embark on any kind of journey within these woods.

Animals flee it, as do humans.

You were just naive when you came here to dump a head.
You had no idea.

The arrangement of the disposing of body parts was something that grew as you once dropped an arm from the backpack and as you tried to searching for it you couldn't find it.
You dropped more parts on purpose during a couple of months and they all disappeared.

"It" became like a guardian of the secrets buried between the trees.

[[The enigma regarding what "It" is may very well never be answered|f24]]

links.text: The enigma regarding what "It" is may very well never be answered

passages.name: f22
passages.text:
Your relationship has always been a bit of a mystery.
But like the old couple you've always been and now become,
you try to stay out of each other’s way.

But "It" takes a step towards you now.
Crossing that invisible border.
Closing in.

You won't budge. You must stand your ground and show that you have the courage needed to mentally defeat "It".

At the same time, [[this doom might be a bliss|f23]]...

links.text: this doom might be a bliss

passages.name: pickup
passages.text: "911 what's your emergency?"\n\n<<timedinsert 2s>>[[answer the good lady|answer]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: f19
passages.text:
At first you think that you might have heard wrong.

But then you feel that presence.

In over 20 years you haven't forgotten about that.
About "It".

"It" is walking around. At the agreed upon fringe where you shan't cross.

The silent forest is still. Peaceful. And intruding.
You walk around the container.

Trying to signal that it's just you.
Like waving to an old friend.

You don't really know that much about "It".
But as you've took care off you're business during the years in silence you can appreciate others seeking the same discretion.

[[Who's been feeding "It" during the years?|f20]]

links.text: Who's been feeding "It" during the years?

passages.text:

And skipping calls means that people out there can be in serious danger.
Maybe even DIE!"

passages.name: e7
passages.text:
To kill to hide another kill.
Never have you been forced to act like that.
But these are truly desperate times.


But should Alex suffer for your actions?


There's nothing wrong with experimental wok night really!
Alex is fine and doesn't maybe deserve a monster like you?


But Alex is the one who put you in this position with all the routine
and double dating and nagging on about meeting friends and family.


[[...|e8]]

passages.name: e6
passages.text:
So you're probably fucked.
Even if "they" won't do anything.
Alex is like a blood hound not giving up.

You have only yourself to blame.
You idiot.

You managed to avoid answering questions about the pain killers by simply making a scene about trust and other stuff you can't remember right now.

Then you stormed off to work and Alex has called seven times.


[[fuck|e7]]

passages.name: e1
passages.text:
As you've come to sleep like an infant...Alex has gotten weary and restless.

At first you can't understand, but as Alex complains about Drew never answering the phone you start to fathom the consequences of what you've done.

@@font-weight:bold;DAY 1 of WORRIES:@@

<<timedinsert 8s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"I'm worried for Drew"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 10s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"Why? I'm sure your cousin will show up"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 13s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"But this is new. Not returning phone calls..."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 15s>>[[...|e2]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: f10
passages.text:
A few minutes later you're outside the store without any of the goods you sought to purchase.

The store behind you is a "no-cash-store" and doesn't even use regular bills and coins anymore.

As you got upset and yelled that you most certainly wouldn't want a job there (even if you never asked for one yet) they threw you out.

[[This world is maybe not for you?|f11]]

links.text: This world is maybe not for you?

<<timedinsert 6s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"The police? Eh, is that necessary really? Drew will turn up sooner or later, I'm sure of it!"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: f11
passages.text:
You sit down on a bench and ponder upon your options.

You can either sit here on this bench until you die?
You can try to fit in into this world?
You can commit a crime and get back to prison?
You can kill yourself?

No, none of them seems right.


But you are sure that you want to leave.
[[That's something at least|f12]]

passages.name: eself1
passages.text:
It suddenly becomes so clear. Crystal clear as the expression goes.

Alex isn't to blame.

You are the monster who've preyed amongst the oblivious humans.

Maybe this is for the best?

Turning yourself in wouldn't feel right to Alex.
Prison. You have no concept about it.
Maybe it's great?

Maybe in another situation.

The least you can do before you drive out to your container is [[texting Alex...|eself2]]

passages.name: epi1
passages.text:
It's autumn now.
Leaves die and plunge towards the ground.
Life turns brown and grey.

You enjoy this park.
It's secluded yet open.

One can breathe properly here.
Enjoying life and the bounties if provides.

On a bench near the small lake you sit.
You watch that jogger who's passed you by several times now.

Every time you nod a bit more and smile as to say that you're not a risk.
You’re no one that would hurt you even though it's rather dark and late.

[[...|epi2]]

passages.name: epi2
passages.text:
For the fifth time the jogger passes you by and this time
you even say "hello".

You receive a courtesy "hello" back and even a wave.
But that wave causes the jogger stumble a bit and fall to the ground.

You run to aid, helping the jogger back on their feet.

<<timedinsert 8s>>@@font-family:Kreon;font-size:115%;color:#91204D;"Aw thanks. Big help."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 10s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"No problem at all. By the way. Could you help me with something?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 13s>>@@font-family:Kreon;font-size:115%;color:#91204D;"Yeah sure. What do you want?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 19s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;[["I want to gouge your eyes out"|end]]@@<<endtimedinsert>>

links.text: "I want to gouge your eyes out"

passages.name: f17
passages.text:
You lay down on the table.
Close your eyes and will just take a quick [[power nap|f18]].

passages.name: eself4
passages.text:
You're used to coming up with horrible ways of
inflicting pain, but now you want to find the most humane
way of taking your own life.

Maybe a fire?

A fire where smoke kills you and then the fire takes care of your body.

So this is it.
How could a date with fantastic shrimp cocktails lead to this?

You take off your clothes.
Place them under the table so that it will catch fire.

<<timedinsert 14s>>[[as you sit there you find "peace" in some way, and thusly striking the match against the box causing it to lit ...|end]]<<endtimedinsert>>

links.text: as you sit there you find "peace" in some way, and thusly striking the match against the box causing it to lit ...

passages.name: west
passages.text:
The container’s most interesting wall.
A wall that wouldn't distress anyone if this was maybe a garage,
tool shed or something in that manner.

But you know the walls content's true purpose.
These tools have never been near a car nor a drywall.

They've experienced something completely different.

What saddens you is that only one of two people inside the container
have seen that wall.

And then, and idea!
Is the delay worth it if you were to [[wake|wake]] your guest up?

[[ok|me]]

<<set $west = true>>

passages.name: StoryAuthor
passages.text: PaperBlurt

passages.name: f15
passages.text:
You park the car and in a symbolic rage you throw away the keys.

The hike seems longer with your hurting knee.
You think of that traffic light.
Of choices that you've made and how life turned out.

You could've been dead now.
But you aren't.
You are a soon-to-be deranged serial killer with a new urge to play [[BINGO|f16]].

passages.name: south
passages.text:
The south wall is, unlike the other walls, smeared
with...something. Brownish grey and green.

A splatter the size of a toilet seat.
Hard to determine exactly witch orifice that
could've provided the wall with this decoration.

I bet that if you sat down with a pen and paper and just
tried to write down each victim you wouldn't get far.

[[ok|me]]

<<set $south = true>>

passages.name: INSERT MACRO
h2
passages.text:
At home.
Safe and sound.
It's a bit late, but Leno might be doing a longer monologue.

You put the head in the freezer.
It's always hard to tell when you'll be ready to discard it.
Sometimes you have no problem at all dumping it with the other body parts.

For the longest, you've kept a head for 12 weeks.
It kinda lost its panache at the end.

The stack of TV dinners is soon depleted.
You need to shop.
Probably get some other nutrition in you too.
But you have others things on your mind.

[[Set the micro wave on "HIGH" for 6 minutes|h3]]

links.text: Set the micro wave on "HIGH" for 6 minutes

passages.name: h3
passages.text:
"...but who'll date him now?!"

(the crowd claps and laughs as seals expecting yet another fish)

But instead we're treated to some commercials.

One talks about a new detergent. One about candy.

Nothing wrong with commercials.
You got your hands on probably the best knife you've ever had as you channel surfed one sleepless night and ended up on the Home Shopping Network.

Leno is back on.
One guest is somebody you’ve never heard of.
The other one is some young Hollywood hunk that's in this new movie
about robots who become radioactive and kills humans, and now the hunk has to fight them all.

[[you turn off|h4]]

passages.name: h1
passages.text:
You feel law abiding for once.
Ironic really.
You have no problem in committing some of the most heinous crimes,
but in traffic you're a model citizen.

You make the final turn and end up on your own street.
A spot right in front of your apartment building!
Apparently God //doesn't// frown upon your doings and punishes
you by having you circle around the block 50 times.

[[turn off the engine. grab the head. make sure that you've locked your car|h2]]

links.text: turn off the engine. grab the head. make sure that you've locked your car

passages.name: h6
passages.text:
You start your new day by taking a gander at your head.

Not your own but the one in the freezer.

It looks so peaceful and still laying there, amongst some ice cream and food...

The morning routine.
One of the very few routines you can indulge in...


[[shower. brush. poo. breakfast. coffee (no wait tea instead!). grab the keys. say goodbye to head. down the stairs. into car. drive one of many detours. watch your back. park the car. walk a few feet. enter job|job1]]

links.text: shower. brush. poo. breakfast. coffee (no wait tea instead!). grab the keys. say goodbye to head. down the stairs. into car. drive one of many detours. watch your back. park the car. walk a few feet. enter job

passages.name: end3
passages.text: <<timedgoto "f1" 3s>>

passages.name: h4
passages.text:
You stare at the soon-to-be-done TV dinner in the micro wave.
It's almost mesmerizing.

You suddenly see [[Leno|lenospin]] in there...

passages.name: h5
passages.text:
The TV dinner lacks taste and smell.
But you get some much needed energy.

You eat it naked, standing up.
After a hot shower you take one last look at the head before night time.

The eyes are still open.
You close them and hum some bars from a lullaby maybe your mom sang to you?

A mom who took care of you.

You're not the typical serial killer with the cliche background...

[[But you're a sleepy serial killer|h6]]

links.text: But you're a sleepy serial killer

passages.name: k10-2
passages.text:
A few day goes by and you are already in the container together with Drew.

But in the same fantasy Alex is outside the container pounding on it and yelling for you to stop.

You work as if in a haze. The headache hasn't let go of you but you try to work through it.

But then, just a few days after that dinner, Drew. enters. the Walmart.

[[and your world. stops|k11]]

passages.name: Start
passages.text:
<<replace "Start the game!">>(this isn't a game)<<becomes>>(never mistake this for a game)<<becomes>>(and I don't mean "this is art" or something like that)<<becomes>>so this isn't a game?<<becomes>>(exactly. now you got it)<<becomes>>(basically...this is just what happens)<<becomes>>[[ok|title]]<<endreplace>>


@@font-family:courier;opacity:0.4;color:black;font-size:25%;(tw: torture)@@

@@font-family:courier;opacity:0.4;color:black;font-size:35%;an interactive text made for IFcomp 2014@@
@@font-family:courier;opacity:0.4;color:black;font-size:30%;best experienced in Chrome on a computer@@







@@font-size: 40%;color:black;Made by [[@PaperBlurt|https://twitter.com/paperblurt]] | More games in the [[Twine Album|http://thetwinealbum.paperblurt.com/]]@@

passages.name: k10-1
passages.text:
You talk even more, and as the night is coming to an end
you feel exhausted.

As Drew leaves and Alex babbles on about how good the wine tasted
and how fun this was, you are in your own world.

You let imagination roam freely inside your mind even though you
can't seriously be contemplating murdering Drew.

But could it be a must to kill Drew so you can continue on with Alex?
To go even further in this relationship.

[[Oh GOD fucking hell this is horrible|k10-2]]

links.text: Oh GOD fucking hell this is horrible

passages.name: e4
passages.text:
@@font-weight:bold;DAY 19 of WORRIES:@@

<<timedinsert 2s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"I've talked to the police yet again. They either don't have any leads or the interest to pursue this. They told me that in those days since Drew's been gone about 40 other people went missing."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 6s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"That's real horrible. So maybe there's nothing to do then?"@@ (at least for Alex, you could maybe panic a bit)<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 9s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"No I'm not giving up. Drew's car is gone too."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 12s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"Maybe stolen?"@@ (or dumped by you where nobody will ever find it)<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 14s>>[[...|e5]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: job3
passages.text:
Finding...a new ”guest” is much like being attracted to a person.

That's why you can't restrain yourself to NOT finding someone interesting at your job.

Once or twice, as you stock some new razors or whatnot, an interesting person walks by.

<<timedinsert 6s>>[[As it does right now|job4]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: f20
passages.text:
Maybe "It" doesn't have to feed?
Maybe it's just a hobby?
Like the urge you've felt.
You've never needed to kill.
It's never something necessary for your survival.
Maybe to keep your sanity but that's something else.

Your elderly eyes squint as if to focus.

Then, [[closer than ever before|f21]], you see "It".

passages.name: pd21
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Thursday the 27th@@

So. Sam is this <<cyclinglink "interesting" "irritating">> little criminal with a track record containing a murder or two.

I've deiced to make Sam my new sanity project.
Someone that can keep my interest peaking.


>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd22]]@@

passages.name: f24
passages.text:
You feel that same breath behind you.
That same paw on your back slowly pushing you towards the ground.

But this time panic starts to brew within you.

The last time you two touched it was with trust and friendship.
This type of brutality signals something else.

Something horrible.

A nose sniffs your head.
A fang is seen in your peripheral view.

"Is that talons" is your very last thought before "It" impales you.

You see the container in front of you and you actually wave and whisper softly "good bye".

Blood pours along side your love handles and even though you're not dead, "It" starts to devour you.

[[Your knee doesn't hurt anymore...|end]]

passages.name: job2
passages.text:
You //could// see yourself as a lion.
And Walmart as your prairie.
A beast on the prowl...

But it would rise suspicions if people visit Walmart just before
they disappear. And then "they" would be gaining on you...

Of course there are exceptions to the rule.

But you can't help it.

If you do find an interesting...”gazelle” you try to find out the persons name or license plate and then give it a week or three.

[[...|job3]]

passages.name: k13
passages.text:
As a creature on the prowl you stalk the unsuspecting Drew.

Dinner is waiting at home...

(but Alex will understand as you call from the car or something and lie about a busted fork lift or something else that explains why you have to stay late, but of course you're ever so sorry)

Drew hasn't spotted you as you keep your [[distance|k14]].

passages.name: k12
passages.text: >>@@font-size:1200%;color:darkred;font-family:nosifer;kill@@ <>

passages.name: k11
passages.text:
As you sneak up on Drew you try to avoid customers that just want to ask a little question about something they don't understand in any way at all but have set their mind on. Like old people with computers or a parent buying their kid a video game or someone without the right size trying to guess what jeans to buy for their sister's birthday...

At a shelf with soy sauce Drew suddenly sees you and almost shrieks.

(yes it was fun last time we met. oh didn't you know I work here? how fun to run into you. yes of course. it's in aisle 15).

It's late. The urge is calling for your attention as Drew walks about the store.

Alex's voice echos through your mind.
But sometimes the monster inside you beats the human.

[[And this is such a time|k13]]
<<timedgoto "k12" 5s>>

links.text: And this is such a time

passages.name: k10
passages.text:
What was that?
<<timedinsert 2s>>Quite intense...<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 4s>>Yet it felt right and, something more. A pain is forming in your skull. A horrible headache is born.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 7s>>[[you sit through dinner, laughing and trying to learn more about Drew at the same time as Alex is just glad that you two actually clicked...|k10-1]]<<endtimedinsert>>

links.text: you sit through dinner, laughing and trying to learn more about Drew at the same time as Alex is just glad that you two actually clicked...

passages.name: k17
passages.text:
****...Drew wakes up to see the door closing.


<<timedgoto "k18" 7.9s>>

passages.name: k16
passages.text:
The road feels longer than usual.
But there's the exit.
The turn leading to the forest that leads to the container which in a sense leads to death.

But you're here.
Night is here.
One of the few friends a serial killer has.

Drew was a bit heavier than you could muster.
But you made it...

And just as you've [[entered the container and put Drew on the table...|k17]]

links.text: entered the container and put Drew on the table...

passages.name: k15
passages.text:
No moans are heard throughout the night.
No struggle.

You feel like a kid opening that very first Christmas gift that you know is that Nintendo you've longed for so long!

All is perfect except that agonizing headache.
It's beyond anything you've felt...

(there must be some pain killers in the car, and surely, after you've pulled aside and rummage through the glove department you find some)

You're not keen on drugs but this moment shan’t be ruined by something as simple as pain.

[[Pain is saved for Drew|k16]]

passages.name: k14
passages.text:
The parking lot is getting is soon completely vacant..
Cars leave the area and you remember that your car is at the employee parking on the other side of the store.

Drew is about to leave and you don't have the patience to listen to your own damp voice of reason trying to get your attention.

Instead of the standard procedure you just run and knock the poor unexpected Drew in the head and drive off.


[[You are used to driving a Volvo but this Fiat will just have to do...|k15]]

links.text: You are used to driving a Volvo but this Fiat will just have to do...

passages.name: f5
passages.text:
They shout at you.
Maybe they have friends on the inside so they recognize the
standard clothing attire presented to newly released prisoner.

Or maybe they just want to pick someone that’s //not// their size.

Pretty harsh words hits your ear drums and you dare not respond as they outnumber you.

Racial slurs are thrown around.

They start to follow you and as you don't respond to them heckling you they actually [[punch|f6]] you - a senior citizen falls to the ground.

passages.name: transfer
passages.text: <<timedgoto "ACT1" 1s>>

passages.name: wae
passages.text:
@@font-family:courier new;font-size:70%;//torture method #9//:@@


@@font-family:Arial;font-size:250%;font-weight:bold;"The Adam & Eve"@@

@@font-family:courier;font-size:85%;

No matter who you are, this is uncomfortable beyond what's human.

1) Place the parents and the "guest" in the same living room.
2) Start off the parents by getting them to talk about the "guest’s" sex life.
3) Make them slowly deviated from that and instead start talking about their own sex life and instruct the "guest" in how a gag ball is used.@@



[[done|w2]]

<<set $weapon += 1>>
<<set $ae = true>>

passages.name: k18
passages.text:
<<timedinsert 2.5s>>At home you find a sleeping Alex.
You go to bed.
Alex gives you a hug.

You sleep like a baby...<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 6s>>[[And the headache is gone|act5]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: job8
passages.text:
Outside the weather is somewhat gloomy.

"Gloomy"

What a word that is.
Moods and weather can be gloomy.
Seldom you see a gloomy car or eat a gloomy casserole.

You manage to locate the person outside.
Groceries already packed.

But then.
You drop the pen and paper you had in hand.
You drop the jaw.
You drop all memories of the person.

As [[someone new|job9]] comes walking towards the entrance...

passages.name: calm
passages.text:
"Oh I've tried Susan. I truly have.
But the only thing to do now is to talk to Lars and see if I can switch shifts and even maybe work stations so I'm as far away from her as possible.
I can't stand her!"

[[(She's the crazy one) Ok. Ah, speak of the devil, break time is over.|work]]

links.text: (She's the crazy one) Ok. Ah, speak of the devil, break time is over.

passages.name: f18
passages.text:
Fourteen hours later you wake up.

You hear a noise outside.
A trampling. Something walking about.

Your ancient mind doesn't really keep up with where you want to end up inside your head. Therefore it takes a while until you come to think of "It".

You had forgotten about "It".

You sneak out.


[[Very quietly|f19]].

passages.name: TIMEDINSERT
north
passages.text:
Cleaning supplies.
Cramped on the floor - buckets and mops.
Filled shelves - chlorine and soap.

Human sized plastic bags (you remember how hard it
was to get a hold of those as they had to be easy for animals to tear to get to the flesh).

A clean house is a virtue. Maybe not, but you can’t really stand (or afford) uncleanliness.

[[ok|me]]

<<set $north = true>>

passages.name: eself3
passages.text:
The drive feels longer than usual.
You feel even sadder as you don't have time
to listen to the last chapters of "American Psycho".

It feels weird not carrying a body as you close in on the container. In some weird manner you think that this is how your "guests" must have felt (if they were somewhat awake).

The hidden torture room is like a monolith rising up towards the sky.

Inside it you feel the stale smell of blood that simply can’t be rinsed out.

[[you close the door|eself4]]

passages.name: j8-1
passages.text:
At the dump site now.
It took a while for you and "It" to understand each other.

But now you help solve each other's problems.

The lack of other animals makes "It" hungry and you need to get rid
of body parts (but not the head as you often want to save that, for a while).

On a little knoll you place the chopped parts in a pile.


And then, just simply [[walk away|j9]] towards the car.

passages.name: wisdom
passages.text:
"Yes Lars has a lot to offer, unlike Annette.
Oh there's Lars now, isn't break time over?"

[[Oh you're right!|work]]

passages.name: wake
passages.text:
@@opacity: 0.3;<<timedinsert 1s>>Smelling salt does the trick<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 2s>>Ammonium burns the nostrils<<endtimedinsertSS

<<timedinsert 3s>>Slowly opening the eyes<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 4s>>Your guest looks around<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 5s>>A figure in the dark<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 6.5s>>Not recognizing the room<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 8s>>Two hands grab the head<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 10s>>The hands displays a certain wall<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 15s>>A most horrific wall<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 18s>>[[unconsciousness|west]]<<endtimedinsert>>@@

passages.name: job9
passages.text:
Here we go again?

<<timedinsert 1s>>
Very good looking. Tall which is nice. Kinda retro stylish jeans. Hair looks really groomed. Dimples! Looks happy. The small car suggest a lack of kids which is good. So f**king cute.<<endtimedinsert>>


<<timedinsert 13s>>[[(nothing?)|job10]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: j18
passages.text:
The lack of routine continues as you head into the city.
You take different routes and you shop at different stores.

Convenience is something to yearn for, but never be able to enjoy.

But you refuse to become a lazy serial killer.

However, you do treat yourself to some routine in your home.
Your private quarters where you watch TV and eat a TV dinners every night.

But that's it!

You shop clothes at different stores and even at work you try to circulate buying your lunch at different restaurants.

[[Oh crap. Leno is almost on!|j19]]

links.text: Oh crap. Leno is almost on!

passages.name: j19
passages.text:
So Leno is soon on and by the way, you actually have to work tomorrow.

You speed up a bit just so you won't miss the entire monologue at least...there's the last traffic light before your turn!

[[...|actnew]]

passages.name: j16
passages.text:
You always save the head for last.
You can't really explain it, but you've never been good at saying goodbye.

It's so definitive to get rid of the head.
To find the right ”guest” to "invite" to the container is more or less the same as attraction. Someone catches your eye and you feel an urge to have that human.

Then to depart is tough.
But it must be done. Sooner or later.

[[almost home|j18]]

passages.name: j14
passages.text:
On the way home you constantly try to find different routes.
You can't really grant yourself with the luxury of routines.
Routine is what get people caught.

One of the few routines you have (if one would define it as such) is your little ”hobby” that you perform in your container.

You often amuse (or scare) yourself by thinking of "It" during the drive home. It keeps you alert and awake (literally). You think of how you went out to the container. Making it soundproof one spring.

Suddenly you react to the fact that you actually //do// hear something in the woods.
It's usually so quiet.

[[You never saw "It" but could feel its breath on your shoulder.|j15]]

links.text: You never saw "It" but could feel its breath on your shoulder.

passages.name: j3
passages.text:
You feel like your mom as you’re cleaning.
She always cleaned naked.
At least the bathroom.
You'd look at her with awe, and wonder why she was naked.
Why her naked body would come so close to all the dirt, fecal matter and urine.

She spared her clothes.
She saved time.
She just jumped in the shower.
It was her ritual, making herself the last object to cleanse.

It took you several years of doing this to understand.

[[But now you too are naked|j4]]

links.text: But now you too are naked

passages.name: j12
passages.text:
Books on tape have really saved you as you've spent more
or less complete weeks in the car, driving home.

First you tried some classics but felt they weren't really you.
Harry Potter did the trick when it came to cure your boredom for a while
and during that time you often took extra detours to listen to just another chapter.

Right now you listen to //American Psycho//.
And you feel that it's "funny as it's true".
You're not a yuppie, but you @@font-weight:bold;do@@ enjoy good food.

[[...|j13]]

passages.name: j13
passages.text:
Serial killers are seldom alike though.
They strive for particular thrills and have different rituals.

And it's hard to reach out and meet others.
There’s not really a ”Killbook” or ”DieSpace” for murderers.
But you haven't really felt connected to those you've read about.
Bateman is the first one. But he's not real.

You are real though.

[[And a bit alone|j14]]

passages.name: j10
passages.text:
Back in the car.
You turn the key and this time you feel confident that nobody will whisk you away from this mess of a life.

Some people who kill are lazy.

Either as they aren't real killers but mere people who take a life in the heat of the moment.

Other are true killers, either it’s in their nature or they actually kill other humans.

But they are often lazy. They seldom travel enough miles from their home. Police have set search area and the killer's dwelling is often within that area.

For you to reach the container you have to travel (by car) 3 hours.
And walk approximately 1 hour into the woods.

Getting all the stuff out to the container took forever.

[[boredom|j11]]

passages.name: j11
passages.text:
You have to be somewhat paranoid if you have this kind of hobby.
It would be easier with model air planes or bird watching.

But maybe cautious is the right word?

The three hour drive is a must to be as far as possible (but still doable) from your home.

On the way towards the container.
Towards the ritual. You feel alive and on edge.
Senses are sharp and you can feel how the heart beats.

On the way home, boredom sets in pretty quick.


[[But one can't laugh all the time...|j12]]

links.text: But one can't laugh all the time...

passages.name: me
passages.text:
The person on the table doesn’t know where you two are.
You know. This is the old container.

It’s been through a lot. As have you.
You honor your container with a look around, as to reminisce a bit
before the games begin.

[[East wall|east]]
[[South wall|south]]
[[North wall|north]]
[[West wall|west]]

<<if $east and $south and $north and $west>>
<<replace "Let the game begin!">>(I told you. this isn't a game)<<becomes>>yeah sorry about that...<<becomes>>(but keep on "playing" if you want)<<becomes>>[[ok|game]]<<endreplace>>
<<endif>>

passages.name: look
passages.text:
The one on the bunk is...

<<cyclinglink "tall" "short" "medium height" "too tall" "too short">>

and has...

<<cyclinglink "brown" "red" "blonde" "black" "bad">> hair

and comes across as...

<<cyclinglink "pretty" "cute" "ugly" "horrible" "sad" "pathetic" "miserable" "a person who deserves this" "a person who might not deserve this">>



[[done|me]]

passages.name: e3
passages.text:
@@font-weight:bold;DAY 7 of WORRIES:@@

<<timedinsert 2s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"So I've managed to get a hold of Drew's credit card bill and it seems that the last time the card was used, by someone, was at the Walmart you work at. Isn't that weird?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 8s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"Oh wow. How did you manage to get that? Isn't that illegal?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 12s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"I don't care if it's legal or not, Drew is gone! And you don't think it's a weird coincidence that Drew disappears at Walmart?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 15s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"We don't know that for sure..."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 17s>>[[...|e4]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: work
passages.text:
You sit down.
Take a sip of water.
Put on your headset.
Wait a few seconds for the light to flash.
Get ready, and then [[pick up|pickup]] the phone.

passages.name: pd3
passages.text: @@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@\n\n<<timedgoto "pd4" 2s>>

passages.name: pd13
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Saturday the 9th@@

I wonder if "It" wonders where I've gone. We did have some kind of relationship that I valued.
Is the forest even there yet? Have the policed kept digging in my case and maybe even found my container?

What is happening out there?
Prison gives more or less no information about the outside world.
At least not in the same amount and pace that I'm used to.
>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd14]]@@

passages.name: pd12
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Sunday the 7th@@

Dear diary!

So far you're keeping me sane.
Times moves really slow (yeah I know I've wrote that in you but I still got 26 mother fucking years left so get fucking used to repetition you fucking cock sucking cunt licking ass wiping diary fucker shit eater!) but I feel calm and at ease...and that's a big win for me!

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd13]]@@

passages.name: pd11
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Monday the 2nd@@
In my papers it says I'm <<cyclinglink "a killer" "lonely">>. I admitted to only one gruesome murder. Not a whole series! So here I am! And I can’t even brag about my track record.

But not that many in here brag.
There's this hierarchy where people who've killed kids are at the very bottom. And I fucking get that. <<cyclinglink "Killing" "Wanting">> kids is not me. And I don't see the charm in killing something that weak. There's a big difference in adult fear in comparison to a kid.

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd12]]@@

passages.name: pd10
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Wednesday the 19th@@

Escaping isn't an option.
Partly as the security is high, and partly as I know squat about fucking escaping from prisons!!!

I hate being in a maximum security facility! But I guess getting the needle, or gas or electricity or maybe being cuddled to death by kittens wasn't really my style.


>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd11]]@@

passages.name: pd17
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Wednesday the 18th@@
Time is starting to fly by.
I'm having difficulties remembering exactly how I used to torture people. Not how to do it, but the procedure, the ritual.

I woke up tonight and wept like a small child. After 4 years I'm not sure if I can manage much longer.
I find it soothing that other hardened criminals crack in here too. We <<cyclinglink "play" "live">> this game in here. Cocky and tough. But at night I can hear the anonymous sobs...
>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd18]]@@

passages.name: pd16
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Monday the 4th@@
So I had some kind of evaluation today.
That was weird. It was like that guidance counselor you met in school. I got asked about how I liked it in here (I'm not kidding they asked like if the answer was gonna be positive) and if I felt I "adjusted".

Adjusted. That's a funny word. Of course I adjust well or else I'd be killed or raped or beaten to a pulp or something even more horrible.

I wish I could adjust that little fucker.
>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd17]]@@

passages.name: pd15
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Thursday the 14th@@

I've been thinking about the beating-up-an-inmate invite I got the other day.
Does that person <<cyclinglink "respect" "fear">> me? I was never popular in school so maybe I should try to start a gang in here and we could decide what's hot and not and give some inmates the cold shoulder and others a high five.

Yeah. That'll be something...

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd16]]@@

passages.name: pd14
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Tuesday the 12th@@
I got invited to a beating of some inmate who tried to steal some other inmate’s stuff. I don't really know the details.

It felt really weird to be invited to something like that. And that you kinda like invite people. I came to think about all the e-vites that I never got. If everybody had a smart phone in here would I get push notifications that reminded me to beat up someone?

I declined the offer.
>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd15]]@@

passages.name: f12
passages.text:
It comes to you in small portions.
This idea of where to go.

Actually it takes a few days.
Days that you spend on benches, in doorways, even on a toilet floor.
You feel disgusted and desperate.

The money you have left is hard to spend as this money-less society obviously doesn't seek profit but value convenience instead. Ha! Convenience Stores they truly are (you amuse yourself from time to time with small nuggets of humor).

[[Your knee hurts and you feel cranky like a child|f13]]

links.text: Your knee hurts and you feel cranky like a child

passages.name: f13
passages.text:
But finally you do what you should've done as soon as you got out: you steal a car.

And you start to drive.

Towards to forest.
Towards memories.


Towards your old [[container|act6p]].

passages.name: pd19
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Sunday the 31st@@

20 years remain of this <<cyclinglink "punishment" "reality">>.

Shit.
No diary I really mean it: SHIIIIIT!!

Will try to amuse myself with name calling as the new inmates arrive today...


>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd20]]@@

passages.name: pd18
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Friday the 13th@@

Fuuuuuuuuck!!

Something has to happen.
And soon.
I've heard there's this noose you can easily make from some shoelaces and glue...


>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|act3p]]@@

passages.name: f16
passages.text:
It's there.
Overgrown, but there.

You manage to open the rusty door and enter.

It stinks. Of blood and mold.

But your tools are there.
The table. The plastic bags. The knives. The duct tape.

So the police never found it?
Or did they ever search for it?

Is this that ambush you’ve feared where "they" will jump out and catch you?

[[No. They already did catch you|f17]].

links.text: No. They already did catch you

passages.name: agree
passages.text:
"I knew I could talk to you Susan.
You’re one of the good ones in this mad house.
Not like Annette.
Oh it seems like our little chat is over."

[[Thanks! And yeah, let’s get back to work.|work]]

links.text: Thanks! And yeah, let’s get back to work.

passages.name: f14
passages.text:
This feels much better.
You can breath again and you feel a bit younger.

It was terrifying to see how the world had turned its back on nature as you drove out of town and onwards towards the forest.

The "AMP" ads became more and more scarce and suddenly they stopped.

Maybe the tales of these woods have survived throughout the years?
Is that why it's still here?

May you hope for a sweet reunion with your old [[companion|f15]]?

passages.name: mistake
passages.text: "Who else could it be? She never joins us for a smoke anymore and she takes her own //private breaks// instead. I've even heard she skips some calls coming in!"\n\n[[But that's horrible|horrible]]

passages.name: f1
passages.text:
"So this is the future..."

Your first words as you leave prison behind you.
You left everything you've accumulated during these years inside.

A new life must begin.

One guard actually gave you a hug.
They've been there as long as you so maybe it's not that weird.


The future seems [[grey|f2]].

passages.name: f2
passages.text:
They gave you some money and a "good luck".
Apparently you are now adjusted and is no longer a threat to the human race in any way possible.

But...you have a lot of missed murders to make up for.
Almost 28 years (you got released earlier due to good behavior) without a blade cutting into a pancreas.

Then, as the bus going into town stops, you just remember one thing when you climb aboard and feel a sharp pain in your knees:

[[you are old|f3]].

passages.name: f3
passages.text:
Where to?

Bus stop after bus stops rolls on bye outside the window.
You rub your knee and take a look at that card you got.

A card with a number to the parole office handling your case.
You won’t call that number. The card gets thrown in a trash can that greets your gesture with a digital ”thank you”.

But where should you go? Nobody welcomes you. This is the downside of being a loner.
Your home is no more and you feel alienated in this world.

TV screens on the bus tells everybody to buy more "AMP".
What the hell is AMP? Is it a soda?

[[The worst part about being is old is feeling old|f4]]

links.text: The worst part about being is old is feeling old

passages.name: f4
passages.text:
End of the line.
How symbolic.

The bus driver looks angry at you.
Maybe you have that aura around you that says "don't mess with me" and that's why the bus driver lets you be?

Or maybe the bus driver is just tired and feel as outdated as you.

You get off.
At a bus depot.
You have to walk back to town and curse in silent as you could've been a bit more proactive and just get off at the bus stop you're now walking back to.

On the way towards town you see a [[gang|f5]].

passages.name: LINE BREAK CODE
f6
passages.text: <<timedgoto "f7" 0.3s>>

passages.name: f7
passages.text:
<<timedinsert 3s>>
You wake up a few minutes later.
You actually got knocked out!

The gang is now arguing with another gang.
Maybe about how it's OK to beat up old people?
Or maybe just about drugs or something else trivial in gangland?


You walk on, a bit woozy at first, but soon steady as always.

Just a few blocks later you're in the [[town center|f8]].
<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: f8
passages.text:
To fight over ethnicity is something you've never understood.
You see yourself as maybe the least racist person on earth as you (back in the day) were willing to kill anyone.

On the inside you can't really say we're all beautiful.
But if you cut someone open.
Everything looks the same on everyone:

Heart.
Lungs.
Colon.
Kidney.
Kidneys.

No differences.

[[You walk into a super market hoping to find food, clothes and work|f9]]

links.text: You walk into a super market hoping to find food, clothes and work

passages.name: f9
passages.text:
The kidneys.

That must be your favorite organ.
On the inside you saw prison as societies kidneys striving to "cleanse" out all the bad stuff, but seldom managing to do a good job.

You've known for quite some time that you'll try to kill as soon as you got out. But now you got this knee thing and the draft in this store is just killing you and you’re aching for an early dinner.

Between all the ads for "AMP" you manage to find some food you recognize. It’s hard to find some clothes without sexy tag lines so you settle for "XXX FTW!" and
[[go to the cashier|f10]].

passages.name: drive4
passages.text:
In all this commotion you forgot about the...head.

As that thought is about to leave your head you hear a scream.

It can't really be due to the accident.
That shock must have settled somewhat amongst the bystanders.

Of course you understand what this is all about.

But you take a moment and again try to spot the other drivers. One is dead. An old lady.
The other is a scrawny teenager out with the driving instructor.

Yet another scream.

As if it happened in slow motion you see the police officer running towards your car, raising the gun, and you take a look next to you, then on the busted wind shield.

[[And of course you can't find the head anywhere.|pd1]]

links.text: And of course you can't find the head anywhere.

passages.name: EITHER MACRO
passages.text: window.either = function() { return arguments[~~(Math.random()*arguments.length)];}

passages.name: drive2
passages.text:
So the wickedness you cause have finally turned on you.
As you ran against the red light you took a
glimpse of the head next to you causing you to miss
the other car coming from the right.

Your precious Volvo is wrecked.
The car that hit your rear is a metallic carcass.
And the car that you rammed is no more

[[your head hurts|drive3]]

passages.name: anne2
passages.text:
"You know exactly what I mean.
She can't shut up about her new house and the new car and whatnot"

[[Well of course she's glad for her new wealth.|anneglad]]
[[Yeah I know exactly what you mean!|annesad]]

links.text: Well of course she's glad for her new wealth.
Yeah I know exactly what you mean!

passages.text:
@@opacity: 0.5;ACT V:@@
@@font-size: 60%;opacity: 0.5;"a parched life vanishing into a neoteric world"@@

<<timedgoto "end3" 5s>>

passages.text:
@@opacity: 0.5;ACT VI:@@
@@font-size: 60%;opacity: 0.5;"an axiom onerous to embrace"@@

<<timedgoto "e1" 5s>>
