end
passages.text: **@@font-size:85%;color:darkgrey;<<timedinsert 3s>>the end<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: harsh
passages.text:
"If you think that's harsh then you understand how truly upset I am Susan.
I'm a timid woman who take pride in my work and I seldom use harsh language.
But this Annette character drives me crazy!"

[[Try to calm down.|calm]]

passages.name: yog
passages.text:
"You can bet your pension fund on it Susan!
That Annette character can't be trusted."

[[Seems like our break is over...|work]]

links.text: Seems like our break is over...

passages.name: wpopper
passages.text:
@@font-family:courier new;font-size:70%;//torture method #223//:@@


@@font-family:Arial;font-size:250%;font-weight:bold;"The Popper"@@

@@font-family:courier;font-size:85%;

A nostalgic torture method that takes you back to when you were a kid.

1) Take a firm grip of the "guest's" eyelids and place a firecracker under each one.
2) Tape the eye lids shut with duct tape, but let the fuse poke out a bit.
3) Light the fuse.@@



[[done|w1]]

<<set $weapon += 1>>
<<set $popper = true>>

passages.name: k3
passages.text:
A much needed kill.
Yeah that might hit the spot.

These people you've killed during your time with Alex haven't felt...right.

What's interesting is that the urge has
never crossed over to the attraction you feel (felt?) for Alex.

You've seen yourself, at least sometimes, as a monster with human qualities, now you see yourself as a human with monster qualities.

<<timedinsert 12s>>[[BUT NOW YOU'VE EVEN BEEN ON A DOUBLE DATE!|k4]]<<endtimedinsert>>

links.text: BUT NOW YOU'VE EVEN BEEN ON A DOUBLE DATE!

passages.name: k2
passages.text:
Alex is great.
Really great.
Super-duper great actually.

But maybe a bit stale.
But that's just when it's not super-duper-ultra-mega-great!

At work everything is normal.
As it was before.

It becomes a much needed sanctuary for the temporary couple refugee that you’ve become.

[[work.work.work.work.work.work|k3]]

passages.name: k1
passages.text:
What was at first exiting, new, fresh and that Harlequin-like adventure you've often heard of, suddenly lacks it all.

Alex is still...fun.

But the urge provided you with a rush that seldom Alex provides.
You get other things instead.

You’ve felt like this before.
A feeble minded child that that just wants the latest shiny ball bouncing by.

[[these boxes have to wait as work approaches|k2]]

links.text: these boxes have to wait as work approaches

passages.name: k7
passages.text:
Pretty slim.
But 47 days later that someone comes into your life.

47 horrible days that have taken their toll on you.
47 days where poor Alex had to take a lot of shit from you.

But then. On day 46 Alex says:

<<timedinsert 8s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"You know my cousin right?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 10s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"Yeah I don't remember the name gosh darn it..."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 13s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;(a smile) I invited //Drew// for dinner at our place, tomorrow. I thought it was time to meet some family. We've been close ever since both our parents passed away and I think you two could click."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 18s>>(this was inevitable, but at the same time not a big deal)<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 21s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"So I hope it's OK?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 23s>>[[(of course it is)|k8]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: k6
passages.text:
But you still want to kill someone.
You yearn for it.

But what are the chances that just the right kill will [[walk on by just as you need it the most?|k7]]

links.text: walk on by just as you need it the most?

passages.name: k5
passages.text:
Then comes that look.
A quick glance as your eyes meet and you feel that old feeling.

Maybe role-playing could work?
You could play yourself and Alex could play a customer at Walmart who caught your eye, and you help that customer who dropped something and then you feel that tingle in your stomach again.

<<timedinsert 10s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"Thanks for lunch..."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 12s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"No problem at all, and dinner will be waiting at home."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 14s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;(a genuine smile) "Yeah I know"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 18s>>
[[This isn't so bad!|k6]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: k4
passages.text:
A kill beyond kills might make you feel like you again.

But it has to be just right.

Not like that web editor douche that barely could withstand
the simplest and most gentle form of torture and died from
pure horror and that little speck of pain you inflicted.

[[here comes Alex for lunch|k4-1]]

passages.name: answer
passages.text:
@@font-family:lekton;<<timedinsert 1s>>"I'm not a single locust.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 4s>>I'm a swarm, dispersing havoc amongst the lesser men
whilst I ravish the world as I see fit without any regret.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 7s>>Others will see my swarm and understand it - accepting it.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 9s>>No shelter shall shelter thee.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 11s>>We are here."<<endtimedinsert>>@@

@@font-family:Oranienbaum;font-size:115%;<<timedinsert 15s>>[[are you in need of assistance?|answer2]]<<endtimedinsert>>@@

links.text: are you in need of assistance?

passages.name: pd27
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Thursday the 1st@@

So diary! I found that thing! That thing that will keep me sane for the rest of this <<cyclinglink "horrible" "evolving">> experience.

The prison provides all inmates with different kind of hobbies. Don't know if ”hobbies” is the right word. But anyway!

I'm into POTTERY now! It's mesmerizingly relaxing!

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd28]]@@

passages.name: k9
passages.text: >>@@font-size:1200%;color:darkred;font-family:nosifer;kill@@ <>

passages.name: k8
passages.text:
On the 47th day Drew came by.

Such a familiar feeling.
The attraction began anew...
And it felt very right...

<<timedinsert 6s>>
Perfect hair. <<timedinsert 2s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>> Perfect nose. <<timedinsert 2.2s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>> Perfect eyes. <<timedinsert 2.4s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>> Perfect hands. <<timedinsert 2.6s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>> Perfect body. <<timedinsert 2.8s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>> Prefectfd. Prefecct. <<timedinsert 3s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>> Preddetft. <<timedinsert 3.2s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>> Prefectftta. <<timedinsert 3.4s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>> Pref. Prefecetttttfd. <<timedinsert 3.6s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>> Pfrec. Perfect rectum. <<timedinsert 3.8s>>@@color:darkred;font-size:145%;KILL!<<endtimedinsert>><<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedgoto "k9" 10s>>

passages.name: pd22
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Sunday the 16th@@

Fantastic diary!

Sam said "hello" to me today in the cafeteria and I felt I wanted to reply with a <<cyclinglink "hug" "elbow in the face">>.

But I kept my cool. What I have in store for Sam can wait.
I've tried to find out as much as I can, but it's always fun with some surprise to learn when I find someone "new.

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd23]]@@

passages.name: pd23
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Tuesday the 22nd@@

Sam has been here for a year now and we've talked a bit.
Said "hi" now and then.

I did leave a <<cyclinglink "cookie" "mutilated rat">> on the bunk, as a gift. But it stirred up all this ruckus and Sam got nervous. So maybe it's better to tread with caution.

Nobody knows it was me.

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd24]]@@

passages.name: pd20
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Friday the 11th@@

So maybe I've found that something that I needed in here after all.
And that something is Sam.

Sam, that little <<cyclinglink "cutie" "idiot">> is in the cell next to me. Brand new to this establishment and I'm gonna make the "adjustment" smooth.


>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd21]]@@

passages.name: CYCLE
ealex1
passages.text:
OK so you grown accustom to your life.
It's sad but true and if the world sees your actions as monstrous
then you'll be the monster they expect to see.

Or wait. Can maybe "It" be that much needed help you seek?

[[text Alex|ealex2]]

passages.name: STYLE
pd26
passages.text:
@@font-family:knewave;font-size:140%;font-weight:normal;My prison diary...@@

@@font-size:75%;Tuesday the 27th@@

The only thing that kept my mind working properly is gone.
I got a new neighbor in the cell next to me.

Someone not worthy of my deeds.

I got a weird reputation also. It's causing the other inmates to avoid me.

What the fuck will I do now?

>>>>>>>>>>>@@font-size:135%;opacity:0.6;[[>|pd27]]@@

passages.name: e8
passages.text:
Alex calls again and you realize that these calls will eventually require you to pickup.

As you look within yourself maybe this is where it's all been headed for a long time?
A road few have traveled but those who do always reach the inevitable and harsh end.

You know it’s a matter of hours, MAYBE a day or two before Alex contacts the police again.

Suddenly you feel jealous of Drew who gets more love from Alex than you.
In this situation Alex seems to be more accepting regarding the fact that you are a serial killer than to never knowing what happened with Drew.

[[Weird|e9]]

passages.name: whammer
passages.text:
@@font-family:courier new;font-size:70%;//torture method #105//:@@


@@font-family:Arial;font-size:250%;font-weight:bold;"The Whack-a-Jaw"@@

@@font-family:courier;font-size:85%;

A bit experimental and hard to manage, but worth it if you seek proper torture.

1) Pull out the "guest's" tongue and push a nail through it.
2) Make sure that the "guest” can't retract the tongue as the nail holds it between the teeth.
3) Whack the chin from below with the hammer. The tongue is bit off by the "guest's" own teeth.@@



[[done|w1]]

<<set $weapon += 1>>
<<set $hammer = true>>

passages.name: TIMER
act3p
passages.text:
@@opacity: 0.5;ACT IV:@@
@@font-size: 60%;opacity: 0.5;"the slaying of an equitable elation"@@

<<timedgoto "pd19" 5s>>

passages.name: dateend
passages.text:
Food is good.
Wine is good.
Conversation is good.

But even this date must come to an end.

Alex is too tired for bowling and you don't know how to interpret that and you get nervous, but inviting Alex over is risky as you haven't dumped the head yet.

<<timedinsert 5s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"That was nice. Wasn't that nice? I had a nice time."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 7s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"Yes the food was good, it was nice."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 9s>>(nice? is that all?)<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 12s>>@@font-family:Pompiere;font-size:125%;color:#CA5F0F;"I'm sorry about me skipping bowling. But I'm starting early tomorrow. But I'll call you. Ok?"@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 15s>>@@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;"Yeah I understand@@ (but you don't, you analyze every part of the meal, what the FUCK went wrong?) @@font-family:Lekton;color:#335717;...we'll bowl some other time."@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 18s>>[[so the waiting game begins|d4]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: drive3
passages.text:
A police offer comes running.

It's complete chaos.
But not the chaos you thrive on, but a more...unwanted chaos.

You instantly try to move your legs and feet...no problem there.
Some blood comes from a gash in your forehead but nothing more than that.

You look outside and see one of the other drivers on the curb.
Not looking too good.
